title: So about Jayce's lore...
body:
Remember when Jayce's lore painted Viktor as a cartoon super villain and everyone got mad and made them change it?

Riot certainly doesn't.

I mean, yes, it give some degree of backstory to Viktor, and it's great for Jayce himself. But Viktor deliberately killing a whole bunch of people in order to make them perfect seems...too brutal. Viktor deciding, not only to attempt to fix humanity's bodies, but also their minds seems hypocritical. And Viktor not using robots to attack people just seems out of character.

replies.body:
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}} 

Wanna have some popcorn? I was sure this was going to happen the moment I read the new lore xD

On the one hand, having given so much attention to Viktor's role as neutral figure rather than an outright villain, coupled with the outrage of Jayce's original lore, I doubt the Narrative Team would be so ignorant as to make the _exact_ same mistake. On the other, it doesn't matter if Jayce is a lying liar who lies or Riot decided on just painting Viktor as a villain, there is going to be a ruckus.

In short, pass the popcorn and hold the butter.

I think that it's just Jayce being the asshole that he is. He technically won that fight, so he can dictate how things went down.

I hate Jayce, if that wasn't clear.

Victor had acolytes before as far as I've known and he isn't necessearily so cruel that he would just kill for the sake of harvesting brains.
In Zaun there are a lot of people in need of something Victor can probably give. 
So I think they gave away their brains, for science and xperiments because they believe in victors cause. And those thugs probably worked for him to get augments/drugs/money.

- Just a hypothesis though.

Well Zaun is going to be next, without a doubt. There is icons for both places and you can get the Piltover one at the piltover page. So zaun is going to be next and we will have to see Viktor's side of things. i dont quite think things are as clear cut as it seems. Either way i like how they portrayed Jayce as a bit of an asshole tho.
I thought they were just bodies that he found
